title: Data Catalog Engineer
tagsAndSkills: Microsoft purview,Data Catalog Engineer,Cloud/SaaS,analytics,Data Lake,API,Risk Management,IOT

ambitionBoxData.Title: The Dow Chemical Company Reviews by Employees

jobDescription:
R2053726 Data Catalog Engineer


Job Description:


Dow has an exciting and challenging opportunity for a Data Catalog Engineer Microsoft Purview Specialist on the Data & Analytics Platforms team. This is a position within our Enterprise Data & Analytics organization.The role will align to Dow's Design Your Day approach and allows employees to work remotely but will also require onsite work based on project work and role needs. The selected candidate will be expected to live a commutable distance from our IT Hub in Mumbai (IN) at a frequency to be agreed upon by the employee and their leader. 


As a Data Catalog Engineer Microsoft Purview Specialist specializing in data and analytics solutions, your primary focus will be managing and maintaining the data catalog using Microsoft Purview. They work closely with data product managers, data literacy, data engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure the catalog is up-to-date, accurate, and easily accessible. Their role involves creating and managing data connections, designing and implementing data classification and metadata tagging strategies and access management workflows, and ensuring data assets are properly documented and governed. They also collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data catalog standards, best practices, and provide support and training to users on utilizing Microsoft Purview for data discovery and exploration. Additionally, they stay updated with the latest features and enhancements.

Responsibilities

    • Provide support and training to users on utilizing Microsoft Purview for data discovery and exploration. 
    • Define and implement data classification schemes and metadata tagging strategies to organize and categorize data assets in the catalog. 
    • Establish connections to different data sources, such as databases, data lakes, and APIs, using Microsoft Purview. 
    • Work closely with various teams to understand their data cataloging requirements and collaborate on data integration projects. Gather metadata requirements, validate data sources, and ensure the accuracy and completeness of metadata in the catalog. 
    • Document the data assets in the catalog, including data lineage, data definitions, and data quality rules. Implement data governance policies and procedures to enforce data standards, privacy regulations, and compliance requirements. 
    • Continuously explore and evaluate new functionalities and make recommendations for optimizing data cataloging processes and improving overall data management practices. 
    • Working as part of an agile scrum team. 
    • Mentor and provide guidance to junior employees to foster their professional growth by spearheading a culture of performance around standards and best-practices. 
    • Ensuring Change Management and Configuration Management standards are implemented and executed. 
    • Documenting operational support procedures. 
    • Ensure technical, architecture, and application designs aligns to company IT architecture and security standards.
    • Deep understanding of Microsoft Purview and its features, including data cataloging, metadata management, data classification, and data governance.
    • Strong knowledge and experience in data cataloging principles and metadata management techniques. Skilled in organizing, categorizing, and documenting data assets, as well as managing metadata attributes and relationships within the catalog. 
    • Understand data privacy regulations, compliance requirements, and data stewardship concepts, and be able to enforce data governance policies within the data catalog. 
    • Familiar with various data sources, such as databases, data lakes, and APIs, and can establish and manage connections to these sources using Microsoft Purview. 
    • General understanding of digital industry trends including Cloud/SaaS, Analytics, Social, and Security/Risk Management, and Internet of Things 

Qualifications


    • A minimum of a bachelor's degree in IT or related discipline or a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience. 
    • A minimum of5years of relevant dataplatformexperience(data ingestion, pipeline orchestration). 
    • Recent experience designing and deploying in Microsofts Azure environment and demonstrated understanding of cloud computing fundamentals. 
    • 8 or more years of relevant experience. 
    • Proficient knowledge of various cloud services from Microsoft Azure. 
    • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in Agile software development methodologies and work processes, especially Scrum.

Preferred Skills

    • Ability to thrive in challenging situations and solve complex problems.
    • Manage own work effort in multiple projects with little supervision.
    • Interested about emerging technologies with the ability to quickly learn and exploit cutting edge offerings to achieve business objectives.
    • Displays a strong ownership mindset and leadership behaviors, including strong decision-making skills.
    • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
    • Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Additional notes

    • Relocation assistance is not available with this position.
    • The ability to accommodate a flexible schedule aligned with international time zones is essential

title: Senior Data Engineer
tagsAndSkills: Azure Data Factory,Pyspark,Azure Databricks,Spark MLlib,AI/ML systems,Programming,Spark,Spark Streaming

ambitionBoxData.Title: The Dow Chemical Company Reviews by Employees

jobDescription:
R2053725 Senior Data Engineer


Job Description


Dow has an exciting and challenging opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer on the Data & Analytics Platforms team. This is a position within our Enterprise Data & Analytics organization.The role will align to Dow's Design Your Day approach and allows employees to work remotely but will also require onsite work based on project work and role needs. The selected candidate will be expected to live a commutable distance from our IT Hub in Mumbai (IN) at a frequency to be agreed upon by the employee and their leader.

As a Senior Data Engineer specializing in data and analytics solutions, your primary focus will be designing, developing, and maintaining our data infrastructure and pipelines for the Integrated Data Hub. Your primary focus will be on leveraging Databricks and languages like Spark, Python, and SQL to process and analyze large volumes of data. You will collaborate closely with data scientists, machine learning engineers, analysts, and cross-functional teams to ensure the availability, reliability, and scalability of our data solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines using tools like Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2, utilizing programming languages such as Spark, Python, and SQL. 
  • Optimize and tune data processing and storage systems to ensure high performance and reliability. 
  • Implement data quality and validation processes to ensure accuracy and consistency of data. 
  • Develop and maintain data models and schemas to support data analytics, including reporting, BI dashboarding, AI/ML systems, and custom data applications. 
  • Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to identify and resolve issues in a timely manner. 
  • Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to understand their requirements and translate them into technical solutions. 
  • Stay up to date with the latest Azure technologies and tools related to data and analytics solutions. 
  • Working as part of an agile scrum team and utilizing git for code management, versioning, and collaboration. 
  • Mentor and provide guidance to junior data engineers to foster their professional growth by spearheading a culture of performance around standards and best-practices related to DevOps, DataOps, and MLOps. 
  • Ensuring Change Management and Configuration Management standards are implemented and executed. 
  • Documenting operational support procedures. 
  • Ensure technical, architecture, and application designs aligns to company IT architecture and security standards. 
  • Hands-on experience with Databricks and Spark, including Spark SQL, Spark Streaming, and Spark MLlib.
  • Solid programming skills in Python and SQL. 
  • Strong understanding of data engineering principles, data structures, algorithms, and data storage systems.
  • Familiarity with data lakehouse platform concepts, technologies, and workflows. 
  • Proficiency in monitoring, diagnosing, and troubleshooting issues within Azure services. Ability to optimize performance and scalability of Azure-based data and analytics solutions. 
  • General understanding of digital industry trends including Cloud/SaaS, Analytics, Social, and Security/Risk Management, and Internet of things.

Qualifications


  • A minimum of a bachelor's degree in IT or related discipline or a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience.
  • A minimum of5years of relevant dataplatformexperience(data ingestion, pipeline orchestration).
  • Recent experience designing and deploying in Microsofts Azure environment and demonstrated understanding of cloud computing fundamentals.
  • 8 or more years of relevant experience.
  • Proficient knowledge of various cloud services from Microsoft Azure.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in Agile software development methodologies and work processes, especially Scrum.

Preferred Skills


  • Ability to thrive in challenging situations and solve complex problems.
  • Manage own work effort in multiple projects with little supervision.
  • Interested about emerging technologies with the ability to quickly learn and exploit cutting edge offerings to achieve business objectives.
  • Displays a strong ownership mindset and leadership behaviors, including strong decision-making skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Additional notes


  • Relocation assistance is not available with this position.
  • The ability to accommodate a flexible schedule aligned with international time zones is essential.

title: Mac OSX App Developer
tagsAndSkills: Performance tuning,Backend,development testing,Mobile phones,Design development,Animation,HTML,Adobe
jobDescription:
We are looking for an iOS/OSX developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablet computers. Your primary focus will be development of iOS/OSX applications and their integration with back-end services.

We are looking for someone who has experience with the whole lifecycle of an app development and can single handedly take it from the design till the execution. So, you turn the design to code, code the app, test the app, make it go live and integrate new features.

Once the team grows, you will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.

Job Description
  • Design and build applications for the iOS/OSX platform
  • Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
  • Collaborate with the boss to define, design, and ship new features
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization
  • Add support New Features
Required Skills
  • Proficient with Objective-C or Swift, and Cocoa Touch
  • Experience with Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD
  • Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc.
  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
  • Familiarity with restful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
  • Knowledge of other web technologies and UI/UX standards
  • Understanding of Apple s design principles and interface guidelines
  • Knowledge of low-level C-based libraries is preferred
  • Experience with performance and memory tuning with tools
  • Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
  • Knack for benchmarking and optimization
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools
  • Familiarity with continuous integration
Mandatory Expertise
  • Ability to make beautiful iOS Apps
  • Ability to make beautiful OSX Apps
  • Make apps compatible for both iPhone and iPad
  • Good hold of Figma or Adobe XD
  • Good at HTML,CSS,JS
  • Experience of building Premium Apps
Responsibilities

Responsibilities will include team building handling, client communication, research, analysis, design, development, testing and deployment of the product.

We need someone hero who can handle the whole lifecycle without depending on anyone else.

title: General Manager - Process Training (BPO), Navi Mumbai
tagsAndSkills: Process Training,Bpo Training,Training Management,BPO,Process,General,Management,General management
jobDescription:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Ability to multi task with various clients/projects/stakeholders in a multi geo environment would be required
  • Review Existing Training Materials and Identify need for updating the same. Should be able to ideate and guide on new content/practice as and when necessary
  • Help in designing KRAs for the team/s and periodically review manager performance vis a vis overall team performance at regular intervals.
  • Evaluate clients training requirements and establish training goals/completion milestones for the projects assigned
  • Coordinate training activities looping in Hexaware and client stakeholders at all times.
  • Part take in selection processes for Sr Managers/Managers/AMs/DMs and below for the projects assigned/undertaken
  • Evaluate and assess training needs for the process and the team assigned. Help in metric management and SLAs for the process/es assigned.
  • Work with Call Center management staff to develop and facilitate motivational activities for his/her world span
  • Develop cross-training materials and SOPs, as required.
  • Preparation of relevant Training reports and Dashboards; decks for MBRs,WBRs etc
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
  • Ability to manage teams/geos as allotted and work in a rotational shift environment is required.
  • Indulge and also develop Managers/Sr Managers for on the job requirements and part take in RFQs/RFPs responses and discussions
  • Help and coordinate plans on TTT sessions for new/potential trainers for the department
  • Ability to work rotational shifts in a week if required; this may also include travelling within and outside country locations for extensive time period.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelors Degree completion
  • 16-18 years of prior training experience in reputed call centers with more than 10 years of team handling skills at the Senior management level is required. Should have handled a team of AMs/Managers/Sr Managers during the stints
  • Contact center - Inbound and Outbound Voice and Non-Voice domain experience in the process training area is a must. Soft skills and Communication training knowledge is an add on preferred.
  • Good knowledge /background of the contact center industry training experience is needed. Should have had a background of customer service training expertise (international and domestic) in his/her experience span.
  • Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Must be self-motivator and self-starter.
  • Focused on quality and customer service.
  • Solid time management skills.
  • Must be able to effectively deal with people at all levels inside and outside of the Company.
  • Creative ability, writing proficiency and visual graphics design ability.
  • Ability to multitask and successfully operate in a fast paced, team environment.
  • Must adapt well to change and successfully set and adjust priorities as needed.
  • Must be proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, advanced Excel, including ability to create Power Point presentations, and knowledge of Outlook).

title: Quality Analyst
tagsAndSkills: QC Tools,Feedback,Quality Check,Quality Audit,Call Monitoring,Communication Skills,Call Calibration,Quality Tools
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities:

  • Providing active feedback to agents through Call/ID & generating audit trends as defined or as per critical needs without compromising total target audits in 80% of available time
  • Implementing Quality Monitoring Standards & Monitoring ID movements/follow-ups taking corrective measures towards improvement
  • Participate in huddle sessions, share inputs with Team members related to error trends, process updates and technical issues. Working in close tandem with Assistant Managers and SME's On the process for an excellent team and process performance
  • Quality Analysts contact all the dissatisfied customers and provide a detailed analysis to improve customer experience.
  • Required to provide detailed analysis for escalations, product and process changes/launches.
  • Coordinate for calibration sessions and adherence towards enhancing calibrated process performance
  • Execute and follow-up on the Coaching & Action Plans
  • Work on the latest quality tools
  • Ensure Learning and delivery through implementation of Quality tools as Lean, Kaizen and Six Sigma for achieving internal and client goals on process quality performance
  • Performance Analysis depending on client & process requirements
  • Would have a target on monitoring xxx number of calls/ID each per week, remain up to date with the process and trend of calls as well as demonstrate standards of excellence on process and procedure knowledge.

Qualifications:

  • Any Graduates.

Work Experience:

  • Should have been a Quality analyst for at least 2 years in similar role, Telecom is preferred
  • Experience in call center environment is a must.

Soft skills required:

  • Good communication skills in English/Hindi/Malayalam
  • Self-motivated and a good people management skill.
  • Excellent Written Communication
  • Understanding of the customer centricity and process dynamics
  • Good client interfacing skills
  • Monitoring Skills
  • Ability to be at the service of the internal client.

Other details:

  • Hexaware Technologies Ltd (Hexaware BPS), LOMA, Navi Mumbai.
  • 24/7 shift with 2 rotational week offs.

Interested candidates kindly share CV's at ProtisthaP@hexaware.com with a subject line of "Applying for Quality Analyst"

title: Deputy Manager
tagsAndSkills: BPO Hiring,Team Management,Bulk Hiring,Communication Skills,Non IT Recruitment,Volume Hiring,End To End Recruitment,Vendor Management
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities:

  • Managing team leaders and recruiters to achieve hiring targets alongside source mix
  • Creating strategy to meet the monthly count with daily activities to be done and monitoring the same daily
  • Monitoring daily targets and changing course as required
  • Checking daily/weekly and monthly performance of team leaders/recruiters and vendors to share feedback and future course of action
  • Communicating with stakeholders in regard to seeking support for accounts where hiring is stuck and daily target is not being met. Checking if the issue is at sourcing, compensation, quality, interviews or offer.
  • Training new leads on current hiring process
  • Managing performance of team by coaching, strategizing and consequence management.
  • Ensuring hiring processes are followed and auditing the same regularly.
  • Reviewing and documenting performance of team.
  • Creating presentations for hiring reviews and delivering the same with all relevant answers.
  • Should be able to take on hiring for a new account from RFP stage to delivery stage.
  • Should have the ability to manage a non-vendor team and execute strategy to achieve the numbers from LCC.

Requirements:

  • Should have managed a team of 2 to 3 team leaders and 10-15 recruiters with not less 200 joiners a month for customer service/sales hiring in domestic/international.
  • Should an overall experience of 10+ years in bulk hiring for BPO.
  • Should not have large gaps in the experience.
  • Should have excellent interpersonal skills, convincing skills and people management skills
  • Degree in HR is preferred
  • Should be adaptable to change and open to new ideas.

Other details:

  • Flexible to work 6 days with Sun off.
  • Location: Ghansoli, Navi Mumbai.

Please share your CV''s at ProtisthaP@hexaware.com with a subject line of "Applying for Deputy Manager - TA".
